links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I knew it.""
links.english: "I knew it."
links.polish: „Wiedziałem”.
links.belarusian: „Ведаў”.

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I have three cafeterias to manage...."
links.english: "I have three cafeterias to manage. *Three*. Sylvie tends the bar here, not me, I'm only standing in."
links.polish: „Zarządzam trzema barami. *Trzema*. Tutaj za ladą stoi Sylvie, nie ja – ja ją tylko zastępuję”.
links.belarusian: «Я кірую трыма барамі. *Трыма*. Тут за стойкай стаіць Сільві, не я — я толькі яе замяняю».

links.title: You: ""Where did this Sylvie go?""
links.english: "Where did this Sylvie go?"
links.polish: „I gdzie poszła ta Sylvie?”
links.belarusian: „А куды пайшла гэтая Сільві?”

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""She just, you know..." He shrugs."
links.english: "She just, you know..." He shrugs.
links.polish: „Ona po prostu... No wiesz...” – wzrusza ramionami.
links.belarusian: «Яна проста... Ну ведаеш...» – паціскае плячыма.

links.title: Drama: "His eyes dart from left to right. T..."
links.english: His eyes dart from left to right. This man isn't lying, but he *is* hiding something.
links.polish: Strzela spojrzeniami na prawo i lewo. Nie kłamie, ale *coś ukrywa*.
links.belarusian: Страляе позіркамі направа і налева. Не хлусіць, але *нешта хавае*.

links.title: You: ""She just... what?""
links.english: "She just... what?"
links.polish: „Ona po prostu co?”
links.belarusian: «Яна проста што?»

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""So *now* you're a cop? Forget it.""
links.english: "So *now* you're a cop? Forget it."
links.polish: „Więc *teraz* jesteś gliną? Nieważne”.
links.belarusian: «Дык ты *цяпер* мянтоўка? Не важна».

links.title: You: ""Okay, then.""
links.english: "Okay, then."
links.polish: „Dobrze”.
links.belarusian: «Добра».

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Mhm.""
links.english: "Mhm."
links.polish: „Mhm”.
links.belarusian: «Мгм».

links.title: Empathy: "There's something there and it's no..."
links.english: There's something there and it's not good. That's all you know for now.
links.polish: Coś skrywa i nie jest to coś dobrego. Tyle na razie wiesz.
links.belarusian: Нешта хавае і гэта нешта нядобрае. Столькі пакуль ведаеш.

links.title: You: ""You look like a bartender.""
links.english: "You look like a bartender."
links.polish: „Wyglądasz jak barman”.
links.belarusian: "Ты выглядаеш як бармэн".

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""That period of my life is over. No..."
links.english: "That period of my life is over. Not everyone who stands behind a counter is a bartender, okay? I'm the cafeteria manager."
links.polish: „Ten etap mojego życia jest już za mną. Nie każdy, kto stoi za ladą, jest barmanem, jasne? Jestem kierownikiem baru”.
links.belarusian: „Гэты этап майго жыцця ўжо за мной. Не кожны, хто стаіць за стойкай, бармэн, зразумела? Я дырэктар бара”.

links.title: You: ""But you can still pour me a drink,..."
links.english: "But you can still pour me a drink, right?"
links.polish: „Ale drinka możesz mi nalać, prawda?”
links.belarusian: «Але наліць мне напой ты можаш, праўда?»

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""I could if I were a bartender. But..."
links.english: "I could if I were a bartender. But I'm not, I'm the cafeteria manager. So I won't."
links.polish: „Mógłbym, gdybym był barmanem. Ale nie jestem. Jestem kierownikiem tego baru. Więc tego nie zrobię”.
links.belarusian: «Мог бы, калі б я быў бармэнам. Але я не. Я з'яўляюся кіраўніком гэтага бара. Таму гэтага не зраблю».

links.title: Suggestion: "There may be some way to get a drin..."
links.english: There may be some way to get a drink out of him (even for you) but this is not it.
links.polish: Może i jest jakiś sposób (nawet w twoim przypadku), żeby wydębić od niego drinka, ale ta metoda nim nie jest.
links.belarusian: Можа і ёсць нейкі спосаб (нават у тваім выпадку), каб выбіць у яго напой, але гэты метад ім не з'яўляецца.

links.title: You: ""Understood.""
links.english: "Understood."
links.polish: „Rozumiem”.
links.belarusian: "Я comprędzę."

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""Mhm.""
links.english: "Mhm."
links.polish: „Mhm”.
links.belarusian: «Мгм».

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.english: [Leave.]
links.polish: [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: [Сыходзь].

dialogueTree.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: "A man in his late twenties stands b..."
dialogueTree.english: A man in his late twenties stands behind the counter, inspecting a stuffed seabird. As you approach, he gives you a sideways glance, then looks down again.
dialogueTree.polish: Za ladą stoi mężczyzna przed trzydziestką oglądający wypchanego morskiego ptaka. Gdy podchodzisz, spogląda na ciebie z ukosa, po czym znowu skupia się na ptaku.
dialogueTree.belarusian: За прылаўкам стаіць мужчына перад трыццаццю гадамі, які разглядае набітага марскога птаха. Калі падыходзіш, ён касавура поглядвае на цябе, потым зноў канцэнтруецца на птаху.

links.title: Empathy: "That was disdain in his eyes. Even..."
links.english: That was disdain in his eyes. Even now he is purposefully ignoring you. Looks like he's not a fan.
links.polish: To w jego oczach – to odraza. Nawet teraz ostentacyjnie cię ignoruje. Chyba nie jest twoim fanem.
links.belarusian: Гэта ў яго вачах - гэта пагарда. Нават зараз ён дэманстратыўна ігнаруе цябе. Здаецца, ён не твой прыхільнік.

links.title: Empathy: "Everything is cool between you and..."
links.english: Everything is cool between you and this guy. He's a big fan. Make some small talk.
links.polish: Między tobą a tym gościem wszystko jest w porządku. Jest twoim wielkim fanem. Zagaj do niego.
links.belarusian: Між табой і гэтым госцем усё ў парадку. Ён твой вялікі прыхільнік. Пачні гутарку з ім.

links.title: Empathy: "That was disdain in his eyes. Even..."
links.english: That was disdain in his eyes. Even now he's purposefully ignoring you.
links.polish: To w jego oczach – to odraza. Nawet teraz ostentacyjnie cię ignoruje.
links.belarusian: Гэта ў яго вачах – гэта агіда. Нават цяпер ён дэманстратыўна ігнаруе цябе.
